definition: to skim (through a book)/to read cursorily/to dip into
to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)

sentences.english: PC companies have dabbled in retail with varying results.
sentences.chinese: PC公司都涉獵了零售，但結果各不相同。

sentences.english: In addition, I have chosen to elect all the courses available at my school in this field.
sentences.chinese: 同時俺還涉獵了學大里與心理學相關的所有課程。

sentences.english: Ma has gone on to experiment widely with other types of music.
sentences.chinese: 馬友友也廣泛涉獵其他類型的音樂。

sentences.english: This type of error is very common among dabblers.
sentences.chinese: 這類的錯誤在涉獵者中是很平常的。

sentences.english: An adventurous voluptuary, angling in all streams for variety of pleasures.
sentences.chinese: 一個冒險的酒色之徒，涉獵於各種享樂之中。

sentences.english: Although a little bit of Computer Science.
sentences.chinese: 但我對計算機有所涉獵。

sentences.english: You're better off getting a more well-rounded degree.
sentences.chinese: 你最好在多方面都有涉獵。

sentences.english: H had wide contact with the Buddist monks and extensive Buddhism thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 一生與僧人交往頻繁，佛經涉獵甚爲廣博。

definition: to feel strongly about/to be fond of/obsession/deep commitment
to have a special fondness (for sth)
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to make a contribution/to establish/to found/contribution
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
level of mastery (of a skill or area of knowledge)/(archaic) to pay a visit to sb
